title: Former Young Rich Lister goes into administration
text:
Julie Stevanja once attracted a $30 million valuation on the Financial Review Young Rich List, but her Stylerunner activewear empire was put into receivership on Wednesday.

In a sign that tough retail conditions are extending to the e-commerce space, Sydney-based Restructuring Solutions was appointed receiver of Stylerunner – which former investment banker Stevanja co-founded in 2012, and claimed last year to be turning over $50 million annually – in a deed with Delaware-based debt funder Partners For Growth.

Julie (left) and Sali Stevanja, twin sisters who co-founded Stylerunner in 2012. Sali left the business in 2015. Michele O’Sullivan

Meanwhile, another document lodged with the corporate regulator notes the appointment of two administrators to Stylerunner, one from Melbourne's As Advisory and another from Sydney's FTI Consulting.

The online shopfront of the activewear seller appeared to be operating normally on Thursday afternoon, with no notice visible that the business was in administration.

Sydney-based Stevanja, 38, was valued at $30 million on 2017's Young Rich List, back when she still owned all of Stylerunner, which differentiated itself by offering dozens of often exclusive brands, and claimed to be the world's first online women's activewear aggregator.
description: Julie Stevanja's high-profile activewear business, Stylerunner, has been put into receivership by its debt funder.
